Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class ScanOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.ScanOptions
  • public final class ScanOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to feed options for scanning via BleManager.startScan(ScanOptions).

    • Method Detail

      • scanInfinitely

        public final ScanOptions scanInfinitely()
        Scan indefinitely until BleManager.stopScan() is called. If this is called after scanPeriodically(Interval, Interval), this will override the periodic scan.

      • scanFor

        public final ScanOptions scanFor​(Interval time)
        Scan for the specified amount of time. This method implies a one-time scan. If you want to perform a periodic scan, then use scanPeriodically(Interval, Interval) instead. If this is called after scanPeriodically(Interval, Interval), it will override the periodic scan.

      • forceIndefinite

        public final ScanOptions forceIndefinite​(boolean force)
        Force a indefinite scan. If you choose to scan indefinitely, and don't set this, SweetBlue will automatically pause the scan, and resume it shortly thereafter, to make sure scan results keep coming in as expected. If you pass in true here, the scan will just run until you call BleManager.stopScan(). There's really no reason to do this, but it's left in here to be flexible.

      • scanPeriodically

        public final ScanOptions scanPeriodically​(Interval scanTime,
                                          Interval pauseTime)
        Do a periodic scan. If you want to do a one-time scan, then use scanFor(Interval) instead.

      • withScanFilter

        public final ScanOptions withScanFilter​(ScanFilter filter)
        Set a ScanFilter for this scan.

      • withScanFilterApplyMode

        public final ScanOptions withScanFilterApplyMode​(ScanFilter.ApplyMode applyMode)
        Set a ScanFilter.ApplyMode for this scan.

      • withMatchMode

        public final ScanOptions withMatchMode​(ScanOptions.MatchMode matchMode)
        Set the ScanOptions.MatchMode for this scan.

      • withMatchNumber

        public final ScanOptions withMatchNumber​(ScanOptions.MatchNumber matchNumber)
        Set the ScanOptions.MatchNumber for this scan.

      • withDiscoveryListener

        public final ScanOptions withDiscoveryListener​(DiscoveryListener listener)
        Set a DiscoveryListener for this scan.

      • withPendingIntent

        public final ScanOptions withPendingIntent​(android.app.PendingIntent pendingIntent)
        NOTE: This will only work for devices running android 8 (Oreo) or higher (API level 26+). If a scan is started with this option on a device running android 7 or lower, a scan will not be started. You must make sure to check the result of BleManager.startScan() to know if a scan started. NOTE 2: DiscoveryListener is ignored when using this feature. Set a PendingIntent for the system to use as a callback to your application when new devices are discovered. This is a special scan in that you will get back native BluetoothDevice instances in your activity/receiver. It is recommended to use BleManager.getDevices(Intent) to convert the native android bluetooth device instances to BleDevice instances for you. To execute a scan properly, you need to create a PendingIntent like below: 
         
     PendingIntent pIntent = PendingIntent.getBroadcast(activity, 42, new Intent(activity, MyScanReceiver.class), PendingIntent.FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT);
        You also must remember to create a class which extends BroadcastReceiver, and this class must be added to your AndroidManifest.xml file. eg: 
             
          <receiver android:name="com.myapp.MyScanReceiver" >
             <intent-filter>
                 <action android:name="com.myapp.ACTION_FOUND" />
             </intent-filter>
         </receiver>

      • asHighPriority

        public final ScanOptions asHighPriority​(boolean highPriority)
        This will set the scan to be of the highest priority. This should ONLY be used if you absolutely need it! With this active, ONLY scanning will happen (even if you call connect on a device, or read/write, etc), until you call BleManager.stopScan().
